Description: Rim sherd of North Ionian Wild Goat Style pottery plate; yellowish-beige slip; hook maeander frieze on top of rim; at edge of floor wide black band with three bands in added red superimposed; at edge of floor, part of possible large rosette and lotus petal or leaf in red; edge of rim glazed; on underside, four bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Hayes 1992, 206, N11: "Ware as N10 and the Klazomenian sherd N28: ie. Standard North Ionian. Type related to the series Tocra I no. 615ff, pl.34.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 206, no. N11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.272)
